title: Son of Typhon

| A son of Typhon:* has no hands.
* is an [animal](/wiki/Animal "Animal").
* is [carnivorous](/wiki/Carnivore "Carnivore").
* is a giant.
* is male.
* is normally generated [hostile](/wiki/Hostile "Hostile").
* is [nasty](/wiki/M2_NASTY "M2 NASTY").
* is [strong](/wiki/Strong "Strong").
* can be seen through [infravision](/wiki/Infravision "Infravision"). |                                                          |

A **son of Typhon**, f, is a type of [monster](/wiki/Monster "Monster") that appears in [dNetHack](/wiki/DNetHack "DNetHack"), [notdNetHack](/wiki/NotdNetHack "NotdNetHack") and [notnotdNetHack](/wiki/NotnotdNetHack "NotnotdNetHack"). The son of Typhon is a large and [carnivorous](/wiki/Carnivorous "Carnivorous") [giantkin](/wiki/Giant_\(monster_attribute\) "Giant (monster attribute)") [feline](/wiki/Feline "Feline") monster that is [strong](/wiki/Strong "Strong") and can be seen via [infravision](/wiki/Infravision "Infravision").

Sons of Typhon have two claw attacks and a bite attack.

The son of Typhon can be [warded](/wiki/Ward_\(dNetHack\) "Ward (dNetHack)") by a [hexagram](/wiki/User:Chris/dNetHack/Hexagram "User:Chris/dNetHack/Hexagram").

## Generation

Sons of Typhon are always generated hostile.

Monsters and characters that [polymorph](/wiki/Polymorph "Polymorph") while wearing a [Leo Nemaeus hide](/wiki/Leo_Nemaeus_hide "Leo Nemaeus hide") transform into sons of Typhon.

A son of Typhon may be generated as the guard of a [magic item vault](/wiki/Special_room_\(dNetHack\)#Magic_item_vault "Special room (dNetHack)").

A son of Typhon has a 1⁄3 chance of dropping an uncursed Leo Nemaeus hide upon death, which is reduced to 1⁄20 if the monster was [revived](/wiki/Revived "Revived").

## Origin

[![Wikipedia](/images/thumb/f/f8/Fair-use-wikipedia-logo.png/50px-Fair-use-wikipedia-logo.png)](/wiki/File:Fair-use-wikipedia-logo.png "Wikipedia")

[Wikipedia](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Main_Page "wikipedia:Main Page") has an article about:

***[Nemean lion](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Nemean_lion "wikipedia:Nemean lion")***

The son of Typhon is based on the Nemean lion, a creature in classical Greek folklore that is one of the many offspring of [Typhon](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Typhon "wikipedia:Typhon") and [Echidna](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Echidna "wikipedia:Echidna") according to Apollodorus. Some sources and tellings give a different origin for the beast: Hesiod has the Nemean lion as the offspring of Orthus and an ambiguous "she" (often understood as possibly referring to the Chimera, Echidna or even Ceto) and sent by Hera to terrorize the hills of Nemea; the tradition held by Aelian, Epimenides and Hyginus states that the lion was "sprung from" the moon-goddess Selene, who threw him from the Moon at Hera's request. Its golden fur was impervious to attack, it could not be killed with mortal weapons, and its claws were sharper than swords and could cut through any strong armour.

[Heracles](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Heracles "wikipedia:Heracles") (or Hercules) was tasked with slaying the Nemean lion as the first of his many Labors set by his cousin King Eurystheus. Heracles was tasked with searching for the Nemean lion, and found that it was invulnerable to his arrows; he instead opted to chase the lion back to its cave, where he had blocked one of the entrances and snuck in through the other. Upon meeting the Nemean lion in close quarters, Heracles stunned it with his club and strangled it to death - he then made a pelt out of its hide, using one of the lion's claws per Athena's advice, and wore it for the rest of his days.

- *This page is a **[stub](/wiki/Category:Stubs "Category:Stubs")**. Should you wish to do so, you can contribute by [**expanding this page**.](https://nethackwiki.com/index.php?title=Son_of_Typhon\&action=edit)*

[![This article describes a 3.4.3-based variant of NetHack. Click here for more information.](/images/5/5d/Nh343var-icon.png)](/wiki/NetHackWiki:Next_version "This article describes a 3.4.3-based variant of NetHack. Click here for more information.")

Son of Typhon

From NetHackWiki
Jump to navigation Jump to search
f son of Typhon
Difficulty 18
Attacks Claw 2d4 physical, Claw 2d4 physical, Bite 1d12 physical
f son of Typhon
Difficulty 18
Attacks

Claw 2d4 physical, Claw 2d4 physical, Bite 1d12 physical

Base level 15
Base experience 565
Speed 12
Base AC -10
Base MR 90
Alignment -7 (chaotic)
Frequency (by normal means) 1 (Very rare)
Genocidable Yes
Weight 3000
Nutritional value 800
Size large

A son of Typhon:

  • has no hands.
  • is an animal.
  • is carnivorous.
  • is a giant.
  • is male.
  • is normally generated hostile.
  • is nasty.
  • is strong.
  • can be seen through infravision.

A son of Typhon, f, is a type of monster that appears in dNetHack, notdNetHack and notnotdNetHack. The son of Typhon is a large and carnivorous giantkin feline monster that is strong and can be seen via infravision.

Sons of Typhon have two claw attacks and a bite attack.

The son of Typhon can be warded by a hexagram.

Generation

Sons of Typhon are always generated hostile.

Monsters and characters that polymorph while wearing a Leo Nemaeus hide transform into sons of Typhon.

A son of Typhon may be generated as the guard of a magic item vault.

A son of Typhon has a 1⁄3 chance of dropping an uncursed Leo Nemaeus hide upon death, which is reduced to 1⁄20 if the monster was revived.

Origin

Wikipedia has an article about:
Nemean lion

The son of Typhon is based on the Nemean lion, a creature in classical Greek folklore that is one of the many offspring of Typhon and Echidna according to Apollodorus. Some sources and tellings give a different origin for the beast: Hesiod has the Nemean lion as the offspring of Orthus and an ambiguous "she" (often understood as possibly referring to the Chimera, Echidna or even Ceto) and sent by Hera to terrorize the hills of Nemea; the tradition held by Aelian, Epimenides and Hyginus states that the lion was "sprung from" the moon-goddess Selene, who threw him from the Moon at Hera's request. Its golden fur was impervious to attack, it could not be killed with mortal weapons, and its claws were sharper than swords and could cut through any strong armour.

Heracles (or Hercules) was tasked with slaying the Nemean lion as the first of his many Labors set by his cousin King Eurystheus. Heracles was tasked with searching for the Nemean lion, and found that it was invulnerable to his arrows; he instead opted to chase the lion back to its cave, where he had blocked one of the entrances and snuck in through the other. Upon meeting the Nemean lion in close quarters, Heracles stunned it with his club and strangled it to death - he then made a pelt out of its hide, using one of the lion's claws per Athena's advice, and wore it for the rest of his days.

This page is a stub. Should you wish to do so, you can contribute by expanding this page.

A '''son of Typhon''', {{yellow|f}}, is a type of [[monster]] that appears in [[dNetHack]], [[notdNetHack]] and [[notnotdNetHack]]. The son of Typhon is a large and [[carnivorous]] [[Giant (monster attribute)|giantkin]] [[feline]] monster that is [[strong]] and can be seen via [[infravision]].

Sons of Typhon have two claw attacks and a bite attack.

The son of Typhon can be [[Ward (dNetHack)|warded]] by a [[User:Chris/dNetHack/Hexagram|hexagram]].

==Generation==
Sons of Typhon are always generated hostile.

Monsters and characters that [[polymorph]] while wearing a [[Leo Nemaeus hide]] transform into sons of Typhon.

A son of Typhon may be generated as the guard of a [[Special room (dNetHack)#Magic item vault|magic item vault]].

A son of Typhon has a {{frac|3}} chance of dropping an uncursed Leo Nemaeus hide upon death, which is reduced to {{frac|20}} if the monster was [[revived]].

==Origin==
{{wikipedia|Nemean lion}}
The son of Typhon is based on the Nemean lion, a creature in classical Greek folklore that is one of the many offspring of [[wikipedia:Typhon|Typhon]] and [[wikipedia:Echidna|Echidna]] according to Apollodorus. Some sources and tellings give a different origin for the beast: Hesiod has the Nemean lion as the offspring of Orthus and an ambiguous "she" (often understood as possibly referring to the Chimera, Echidna or even Ceto) and sent by Hera to terrorize the hills of Nemea; the tradition held by Aelian, Epimenides and Hyginus states that the lion was "sprung from" the moon-goddess Selene, who threw him from the Moon at Hera's request. Its golden fur was impervious to attack, it could not be killed with mortal weapons, and its claws were sharper than swords and could cut through any strong armour.

[[wikipedia:Heracles|Heracles]] (or Hercules) was tasked with slaying the Nemean lion as the first of his many Labors set by his cousin King Eurystheus. Heracles was tasked with searching for the Nemean lion, and found that it was invulnerable to his arrows; he instead opted to chase the lion back to its cave, where he had blocked one of the entrances and snuck in through the other. Upon meeting the Nemean lion in close quarters, Heracles stunned it with his club and strangled it to death - he then made a pelt out of its hide, using one of the lion's claws per Athena's advice, and wore it for the rest of his days.
